channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The controversy over live facial recognition cameras in New Orleans
item.description: Law enforcement is coming under scrutiny over its use of live facial recognition cameras.

item.title: Trump's top meme coin investors visit White House
item.description: Some investors in President Trump's meme coin visited the White House Friday, despite officials saying a gala held for them was outside Trump's offici...

item.description: The show had sold 50,000 tickets, according to a release.

item.title: Judge temporarily blocks Trump's ban on Harvard enrolling international students
item.description: Harvard University sued the Trump administration Friday over its decision to revoke the school’s ability to enroll international students.

item.title: Pentagon lost contact with Army chopper in May, causing 2 aborted D.C. landings
item.description: On May 1, the Pentagon briefly lost contact with an Army helicopter nearby, causing two planes to abort landings at D.C.'s Reagan National Airport.

item.title: 4 partners leave Paul Weiss after firm cut deal with Trump
item.description: A group of high-profile attorneys have left Paul Weiss.

item.description: The music agency Sound Talent Group says three of its employees died on the private plane that crashed into a San Diego neighborhood on Thursday.
